biotools.summary: CREME (Cis-Regulatory Module Explorer for the human genome) is a tool for identifying and visualizing cis-regulatory modules for a given set of genes that are potentially co-expressed or co-regulated.  It takes as input a list of accession numbers, and reports back common modules, grouping genes from the list by which modules are found in their promoter regions.

bioschemas.name: CREME
